channel.title: Wrong code

item.title: Wrong code
item.dc:creator: @MeeE59 MeeE59
item.description:
@MeeE59 wrote:

Also, just as a heads up:

if(objectID == 1734){ } if (clanwars.isSaradomin == true) { sendMessage("You go up the staircase."); teleportToX = 3056; teleportToY = 9593; } if (clanwars.isZamorak == true) { sendMessage("You go up the staircase."); teleportToX = 3056; teleportToY = 9593; }

You close the bracket for the object before you even do anything with it. You basically placed the first } too early, it should be at the very end.
Like this:

if(objectID == 1734){ if (clanwars.isSaradomin == true) { sendMessage("You go up the staircase."); teleportToX = 3056; teleportToY = 9593; } if (clanwars.isZamorak == true) { sendMessage("You go up the staircase."); teleportToX = 3056; teleportToY = 9593; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Wrong code
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

		if(objectID == 1734) {
		    if(clanwars.isZamorak || clanwars.isSaradomin) {
		teleportToX = 3056;
		teleportToY = 9593;
		sendMessage("You go up the staircase.");
		}
}

Just add another bracket underneath the code and I cleaned it up a bit for you.

item.title: Wrong code
item.dc:creator: @sertan8 sertan8
item.description:
@sertan8 wrote:

aight so when i add if(objectID == 1734){ } if (clanwars.isSaradomin == true) { sendMessage("You go up the staircase."); teleportToX = 3056; teleportToY = 9593; } if (clanwars.isZamorak == true) { sendMessage("You go up the staircase."); teleportToX = 3056; teleportToY = 9593; }

Every object teleports me to 3056 and 9593â€¦(Only when I am in saradomin or zamorak)

I am 100% aware the bracket after if(objectID == 1734){ causes it. but when i remove it i get 100 errors.

could someone help me out?

Read full topic
